Package net.kemitix.mon.maybe

Interface Maybe<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the content of the Just
All Superinterfaces:
Functor<T,​Maybe<?>>
public interface Maybe<T> extends Functor<T,​Maybe<?>>
A value that may or may not be present.
Author:
Paul Campbell (pcampbell@kemitix.net)

  • Method Details

    • just

      static <T> Maybe<T> just​(@NonNull T value)
      Create a Maybe for the value that is present.

      The value must not be null or a NullPointerException will be thrown. If you can't prove that the value won't be null you should use maybe(Object) instead.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the value
      Parameters:
      value - the value, not null
      Returns:
      a Maybe of the value

    • nothing

      static <T> Maybe<T> nothing()
      Create a Maybe for a lack of a value.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the missing value
      Returns:
      an empty Maybe

    • maybe

      static <T> Maybe<T> maybe​(T value)
      Create a Maybe for the value that may or may not be present.

      Where the value is null, that is taken as not being present.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the value
      Parameters:
      value - the value, may be null
      Returns:
      a Maybe, either a Just, or Nothing if value is null

    • findFirst

      static <T> Maybe<T> findFirst​(Stream<T> stream)
      Creates a Maybe from the first item in the stream, or nothing if the stream is empty.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the stream
      Parameters:
      stream - the Stream
      Returns:
      a Maybe containing the first item in the stream

    • isJust

      boolean isJust()
      Checks if the Maybe is a Just.
      Returns:
      true if the Maybe is a Just

    • isNothing

      boolean isNothing()
      Checks if the Maybe is Nothing.
      Returns:
      true if the Maybe is Nothing

    • flatMap

      <R> Maybe<R> flatMap​(Function<T,​Maybe<R>> f)
      Monad binder maps the Maybe into another Maybe using the binder method f.
      Type Parameters:
      R - the type of the value in the final maybe
      Parameters:
      f - the mapper function
      Returns:
      a Maybe with the mapped value

    • map

      <R> Maybe<R> map​(Function<T,​R> f)
      Description copied from interface: Functor
      Applies the function to the value within the Functor, returning the result within a Functor.
      Specified by:
      map in interface Functor<T,​Maybe<?>>
      Type Parameters:
      R - the type of the content of the mapped functor
      Parameters:
      f - the function to apply
      Returns:
      a Functor containing the result of the function f applied to the value

    • orElseGet

      T orElseGet​(Supplier<T> supplier)
      Provide a value to use when Maybe is Nothing.
      Parameters:
      supplier - supplier for an alternate value
      Returns:
      a Maybe

    • orElse

      T orElse​(T otherValue)
      A value to use when Maybe is Nothing.
      Parameters:
      otherValue - an alternate value
      Returns:
      the value of the Maybe if a Just, otherwise the otherValue

    • toOptional

      Optional<T> toOptional()
      Convert the Maybe to an Optional.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing a value for a Just, or empty for a Nothing

    • orElseThrow

      <X extends Throwable> T orElseThrow​(Supplier<? extends X> e) throws X
      Throw the exception if the Maybe is a Nothing.
      Type Parameters:
      X - the type of the exception to throw
      Parameters:
      e - the exception to throw
      Returns:
      the value of the Maybe if a Just
      Throws:
      X - if the Maybe is nothing

    • stream

      Stream<T> stream()
      Converts the Maybe into either a single value stream or an empty stream.
      Returns:
      a Stream containing the value or nothing.

    • filter

      Maybe<T> filter​(Predicate<T> predicate)
      Filter a Maybe by the predicate, replacing with Nothing when it fails.
      Parameters:
      predicate - the test
      Returns:
      the Maybe, or Nothing if the test returns false

    • peek

      Maybe<T> peek​(Consumer<T> consumer)
      Provide the value within the Maybe, if it exists, to the Consumer, and returns this Maybe.
      Parameters:
      consumer - the Consumer to the value if present
      Returns:
      this Maybe

    • ifNothing

      void ifNothing​(Runnable runnable)
      Run the runnable if the Maybe is a Nothing, otherwise do nothing.
      Parameters:
      runnable - the runnable to call if this is a Nothing

    • match

      void match​(Consumer<T> justMatcher, Runnable nothingMatcher)
      Matches the Maybe, either just or nothing, and performs either the Consumer, for Just, or Runnable for nothing.

      Unlike matchValue(Function, Supplier), this method does not return a value.

      Parameters:
      justMatcher - the Consumer to pass the value of a Just to
      nothingMatcher - the Runnable to call if the Maybe is a Nothing

    • matchValue

      <R> R matchValue​(Function<T,​R> justMatcher, Supplier<R> nothingMatcher)
      Matches the Maybe, either just or nothing, and performs either the Function, for Just, or Supplier for nothing.

      Unlike match(Consumer, Runnable), this method returns a value.

      Type Parameters:
      R - the type of the matched result
      Parameters:
      justMatcher - the Function to pass the value of a Just to
      nothingMatcher - the Supplier to call if the Maybe is a Nothing
      Returns:
      the matched result, from either the justMatcher or the nothingMatcher

    • or

      Maybe<T> or​(Supplier<Maybe<T>> alternative)
      Maps the Maybe into another Maybe only when it is nothing.
      Parameters:
      alternative - the maybe to map the nothing into
      Returns:
      the original Maybe if not nothing, or the alternative
